title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 3. Regulation 20 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
3. Regulation 20 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

in paragraph (1), by the insertion of “or paragraph (12)” after 
“Regulation 3(1)”, 

in paragraph (4), by the insertion of “to whom Regulation 3(1) or 
paragraph (12)(a) applies” after “Union citizen”, 

in paragraph (6)(a), by the insertion of “to whom Regulation 3(1) 
applies” after “Union citizen”, and 

(d) by the insertion of the following paragraphs after paragraph (11): 

“(12) This paragraph applies to – 

(a) 

a Union citizen who entered or remained in the State 
in accordance with these Regulations and who is no 
longer entitled to be in the State in accordance with 
these Regulations, and 

(b) 

a family member – 

(i) 

of a Union citizen referred to in subparagraph 
(a), or 

(ii) of a Union citizen who entered or remained in 
the State in accordance with these Regulations 
and who has departed from the State, 

who, at the relevant time – 

(I) 

entered the State in the company of 
the Union citizen, 

1 OJ No. L 158, 30.4.04, p. 77 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in

(II) entered the State for the purpose of 
joining the Union citizen, or 

(III) became a family member while in 

the State. 

(13) For the purposes of subparagraph (b) of paragraph (12), 
‘relevant time’ means the time at which the Union citizen referred 
to in clause (i) or (ii), as the case may be, of that subparagraph, 
entered or remained in the State in accordance with these 
Regulations.”.

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 4. Regulation 25 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
4. Regulation 25 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (1): 

“(1) A person who – 

(a) has, or who claims to have, an entitlement under these 

Regulations to enter or reside in the State, 

(b) 

is the subject of a removal order, or 

(c) 

is the subject of an exclusion order, 

may seek a review of any decision concerning such entitlement, 
claimed entitlement, removal order or exclusion order.”, and 

(b) 

in paragraph (6), by the substitution of “paragraph (1)(b)” for 
“paragraph (1)”.

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 5. Regulation 27(2) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
5. Regulation 27(2) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 
substitution of “any right, entitlement or status” for “a right, entitlement or status 
of being treated as a permitted family member”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 August, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [445]

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Communities (Free Movement of 
Persons) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 548 of 2015). 

The Regulations amend Regulation 20 (Removal orders - general) of the 2015 
Regulations to provide for removal orders in respect of: 

* Union citizens who entered or remained in the State in accordance with the 
Regulations and who are no longer entitled to be in the State in accordance with 
the Regulations, and family members of such Union citizens, 

* family members of Union citizens who entered or remained in the State in 
accordance with the Regulations and who have departed from the State. 

The Regulations amend Regulation 25 (Review of decisions) of the 2015 
Regulations to improve its clarity in relation to the review of removal orders and 
exclusion orders made under the Regulations. 

The Regulations amend Regulation 27 (Cessation of entitlements) of the 2015 
Regulations to clarify that the investigative powers provided for by Regulation 
27(2) may be exercised in relation to any right, entitlement or status conferred 
by the Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [445] 5
